dt-example.title: Hiding unnecessary grouping information
dt-example.info:
Display of grouping information can be very useful if there are several groups of information shown in the DataTable, but equally it can be redundant if there is a single group of data only, or if every row exists in its own group.
This example demonstrates the `-init rowGroup.hideIfAllSame` and `-init rowGroup.hideIfAllUnique` options, which control the behaviour of RowGroup when encounting these scenarios. They are disabled by default, but can be enabled by setting them to be `true`.
